sentences.english: Both has the fertile soil fertile farmland, bumper grain harvest, and has the broad prairie, a hundred flowers in full bloom.
sentences.chinese: 既有沃土良田，五穀豐登，又有廣闊草原，百花盛開。

sentences.english: The self-restraint, the load bearing ten thousand boat thousand sails, moisten the fertile soil fertile farmland.
sentences.chinese: 自我約束者，承載萬舟千帆，滋潤沃土良田。

sentences.english: Within a few years they had transferred barren wastes into fertile fields.
sentences.chinese: 幾年之內他們就把荒地變成了良田。

sentences.english: The barren land has been turned into fertile fields.
sentences.chinese: 貧瘠的土地已改成良田。

sentences.english: Rich families don't need to buy fertile fields; There are a thousand bushels of millet in books.
sentences.chinese: 富家不用買良田，書中自有千鍾粟。

sentences.english: Urban sprawl is paving over fertile land in the East.
sentences.chinese: 城市的無節制擴張侵佔了東部的良田。

sentences.english: All sunshine and no rain make a desert.
sentences.chinese: 只有豔陽無風雨，良田也會變沙漠。

sentences.english: Scientists are trying to turn deserts into good land again.
sentences.chinese: 科學家們正在努力使沙漠再一次變成良田。

definition: unit of area equal to 100 畝|亩[mu3] or 6.67 hectares/a short while/a little while ago/circa. (for approximate dates)
to clear a wild area for cultivation/to put under the plow
to lie idle (of arable land)/fig. rusty because of lack of practice
